values.description:
Add `//model/@canonical_link` attribute that specifies the name of the model's canonical link, to which the model's implicit frame is attached. If unset, the first link in the model is chosen. This is based on the following section of the proposal:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#2-model-frame-and-canonical-link

It implies that a model must have at least one link. A new error code is added for this case and tested with example sdf files.

`ign sdf --check` also checks that the canonical_link attribute matches a link in the model and has tests.
values.title: [Citadel] sdf 1.7: add `//model/@canonical_link` attribute and require models to have at least one link

summary.raw:
Add `//model/@canonical_link` attribute that specifies the name of the model's canonical link, to which the model's implicit frame is attached. If unset, the first link in the model is chosen. This is based on the following section of the proposal:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#2-model-frame-and-canonical-link

It implies that a model must have at least one link. A new error code is added for this case and tested with example sdf files.

`ign sdf --check` also checks that the canonical_link attribute matches a link in the model and has tests.

Add //model/@canonical_link attribute that specifies the name of the model's canonical link, to which the model's implicit frame is attached. If unset, the first link in the model is chosen. This is based on the following section of the proposal:

  • http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#2-model-frame-and-canonical-link

It implies that a model must have at least one link. A new error code is added for this case and tested with example sdf files.

ign sdf --check also checks that the canonical_link attribute matches a link in the model and has tests.

values.description:
This is all related to frames; it adds the `//frame/@attached_to` attribute, a `Frame` DOM class, and changes where frames are allowed (only the model and the world). These changes are documented in the following sections of the proposal:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#1-2-explicit-vs-implicit-frames
* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#4-details-of-model-frame
* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#5-details-of-world-frame

This includes several new valid and invalid sdf files in the `test/sdf` folder with tests. The `ign sdf --check` command also checks that the `attached_to` attribute values are valid.
values.title: [Citadel] sdf 1.7: add `//frame/attached_to`, only allow frames in model and world, add Frame DOM

summary.raw:
This is all related to frames; it adds the `//frame/@attached_to` attribute, a `Frame` DOM class, and changes where frames are allowed (only the model and the world). These changes are documented in the following sections of the proposal:

* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#1-2-explicit-vs-implicit-frames
* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#4-details-of-model-frame
* http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#5-details-of-world-frame

This includes several new valid and invalid sdf files in the `test/sdf` folder with tests. The `ign sdf --check` command also checks that the `attached_to` attribute values are valid.
summary.html:
This is all related to frames; it adds the //frame/@attached_to attribute, a Frame DOM class, and changes where frames are allowed (only the model and the world). These changes are documented in the following sections of the proposal:

  • http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#1-2-explicit-vs-implicit-frames
  • http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#4-details-of-model-frame
  • http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&#5-details-of-world-frame

This includes several new valid and invalid sdf files in the test/sdf folder with tests. The ign sdf --check command also checks that the attached_to attribute values are valid.

values.description:
Removing these messages because they can be misleading. The `readString` function calls `readDoc` in a couple different ways to attempt to load the string, so a false return due to not finding an `<sdf>` node does not necessarily mean an error.

My specific use case is that successfully loading a URDF file through `readString` prints an error message, which is misleading.

I vaguely remember running into this before and having a conversation on Bitbucket about it, but I can't find it :confused:
values.title: Remove a couple of error messages

summary.raw:

My specific use case is that successfully loading a URDF file through `readString` prints an error message, which is misleading.

I vaguely remember running into this before and having a conversation on Bitbucket about it, but I can't find it :confused:

My specific use case is that successfully loading a URDF file through readString prints an error message, which is misleading.

I vaguely remember running into this before and having a conversation on Bitbucket about it, but I can't find it

values.description:
When parsing a URDF which has something inside a `<gazebo>` tag that is not `<material>`, the parser was creating an empty `<material><script>` tag, which was then populated by SDF with `__default__` `name` and `uri`.

The problem is that `name` and `uri` are required fields inside `script`, so parsing such a model with `sdf::Root::Load` was failing.

This PR prevents the creation of empty material elements, and makes sure they're only created if the user populates them.
values.title: Fix parsing URDF without <material> inside <gazebo>

summary.raw:
When parsing a URDF which has something inside a `<gazebo>` tag that is not `<material>`, the parser was creating an empty `<material><script>` tag, which was then populated by SDF with `__default__` `name` and `uri`.

The problem is that `name` and `uri` are required fields inside `script`, so parsing such a model with `sdf::Root::Load` was failing.

This PR prevents the creation of empty material elements, and makes sure they're only created if the user populates them.
summary.html:
When parsing a URDF which has something inside a <gazebo> tag that is not <material>, the parser was creating an empty <material><script> tag, which was then populated by SDF with __default__ name and uri.

The problem is that name and uri are required fields inside script, so parsing such a model with sdf::Root::Load was failing.

This PR prevents the creation of empty material elements, and makes sure they're only created if the user populates them.

values.description:
The library name is using the versioned library name, which causes this `ign-tools` runtime error:

`Configuration error: File [/home/chapulina/citadel_ws/install/share/ignition//sdformat9.yaml] contains a command already registered by sdformat8.`

For each library, we need that name to be the same across all versions, so that `ign-tools` knows they're differentiated by their version.
values.title: [Citadel] Unversioned lib name for cmds

summary.raw:
The library name is using the versioned library name, which causes this `ign-tools` runtime error:

`Configuration error: File [/home/chapulina/citadel_ws/install/share/ignition//sdformat9.yaml] contains a command already registered by sdformat8.`

For each library, we need that name to be the same across all versions, so that `ign-tools` knows they're differentiated by their version.
summary.html:
The library name is using the versioned library name, which causes this ign-tools runtime error:

Configuration error: File [/home/chapulina/citadel_ws/install/share/ignition//sdformat9.yaml] contains a command already registered by sdformat8.

For each library, we need that name to be the same across all versions, so that ign-tools knows they're differentiated by their version.

values.description: The SemanticPose class provides a consistent way to resolve poses of DOM objects. The class has a private constructor that can be called by specific DOM classes, such as Link in this pull request. It has a weak pointer to the graphs stored by the Model or World and is meant to have a short lifetime. Implementations for other classes will follow; I included on the `Link` implementation here to make it more concise and easier to follow.
values.title: [Citadel] Add SemanticPose class with implementation for Link.

summary.raw: The SemanticPose class provides a consistent way to resolve poses of DOM objects. The class has a private constructor that can be called by specific DOM classes, such as Link in this pull request. It has a weak pointer to the graphs stored by the Model or World and is meant to have a short lifetime. Implementations for other classes will follow; I included on the `Link` implementation here to make it more concise and easier to follow.
summary.html: The SemanticPose class provides a consistent way to resolve poses of DOM objects. The class has a private constructor that can be called by specific DOM classes, such as Link in this pull request. It has a weak pointer to the graphs stored by the Model or World and is meant to have a short lifetime. Implementations for other classes will follow; I included on the Link implementation here to make it more concise and easier to follow.

values.description:
The name checking was much too strict, any xml elements with matching name attributes  that are direct children of model or world were generating errors and causing the DOM loading to fail. This includes `//model/plugin/@name`, and there are many of these collisions in ign-gazebo.

It now warns for any xml elements with matching name attributes. The build*Graph functions now check for collisions among frame names before adding a frame to the graph, rather than checking the XML siblings of all frame elements. Also, I've modified `Model::Load` and `World::Load` to warn and modify any non-compliant Frame or Joint names by appending `_frame` or `_joint` and then appending incrementing integers until a unique name is found.
values.title: [Citadel] Relax name checking, warn and modify frame names in Model, World Load

summary.raw:
The name checking was much too strict, any xml elements with matching name attributes  that are direct children of model or world were generating errors and causing the DOM loading to fail. This includes `//model/plugin/@name`, and there are many of these collisions in ign-gazebo.

It now warns for any xml elements with matching name attributes. The build*Graph functions now check for collisions among frame names before adding a frame to the graph, rather than checking the XML siblings of all frame elements. Also, I've modified `Model::Load` and `World::Load` to warn and modify any non-compliant Frame or Joint names by appending `_frame` or `_joint` and then appending incrementing integers until a unique name is found.
summary.html:
The name checking was much too strict, any xml elements with matching name attributes that are direct children of model or world were generating errors and causing the DOM loading to fail. This includes //model/plugin/@name, and there are many of these collisions in ign-gazebo.

It now warns for any xml elements with matching name attributes. The build*Graph functions now check for collisions among frame names before adding a frame to the graph, rather than checking the XML siblings of all frame elements. Also, I've modified Model::Load and World::Load to warn and modify any non-compliant Frame or Joint names by appending _frame or _joint and then appending incrementing integers until a unique name is found.

values.description:
The pose multiplication operator was [flipped on Ignition Math 5](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/default/Migration.md). SDF6 uses Math4, while SDF8 uses Math6. This suggests to me that no one has tried to use URDF with SDF8 (i.e. Ignition Blueprint).

Before | After
-- | --
![ur10before.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ak8x4z/images/440942032-ur10before.png) | ![ur10after.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ak8x4z/images/3602904911-ur10after.png)

This needs to be backported to `sdf8` after it's merged.
values.title: Fix link pose multiplication for URDF

summary.raw:
The pose multiplication operator was [flipped on Ignition Math 5](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/default/Migration.md). SDF6 uses Math4, while SDF8 uses Math6. This suggests to me that no one has tried to use URDF with SDF8 (i.e. Ignition Blueprint).

Before | After
-- | --
![ur10before.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ak8x4z/images/440942032-ur10before.png) | ![ur10after.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/ak8x4z/images/3602904911-ur10after.png)

This needs to be backported to `sdf8` after it's merged.
summary.html:
The pose multiplication operator was flipped on Ignition Math 5. SDF6 uses Math4, while SDF8 uses Math6. This suggests to me that no one has tried to use URDF with SDF8 (i.e. Ignition Blueprint).

Before After

This needs to be backported to sdf8 after it's merged.

values.description:
It is not stated explicitly in the [SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics proposal](http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&) that `world` may not be specified as a child link of a joint, though we did discuss that to some extent during the design process. I added some tests to see how the current implementation handles this case, and it complains when constructing the `FrameAttachedToGraph` that the child link named `world` cannot be found, which causes the joint vertex to be disconnected from a link vertex. This is not a problem when specifying `world` as a parent link because the joint frame is not attached to the parent link.

We should consider explicitly adding the requirement that `world` not be specified as the child link of a joint to the proposal and SDF specification.
values.title: Add tests to confirm that world is not allowed as child link of a joint

summary.raw:
It is not stated explicitly in the [SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics proposal](http://sdformat.org/tutorials?tut=pose_frame_semantics_proposal&cat=pose_semantics_docs&) that `world` may not be specified as a child link of a joint, though we did discuss that to some extent during the design process. I added some tests to see how the current implementation handles this case, and it complains when constructing the `FrameAttachedToGraph` that the child link named `world` cannot be found, which causes the joint vertex to be disconnected from a link vertex. This is not a problem when specifying `world` as a parent link because the joint frame is not attached to the parent link.

We should consider explicitly adding the requirement that `world` not be specified as the child link of a joint to the proposal and SDF specification.
summary.html:
It is not stated explicitly in the SDFormat 1.7 frame semantics proposal that world may not be specified as a child link of a joint, though we did discuss that to some extent during the design process. I added some tests to see how the current implementation handles this case, and it complains when constructing the FrameAttachedToGraph that the child link named world cannot be found, which causes the joint vertex to be disconnected from a link vertex. This is not a problem when specifying world as a parent link because the joint frame is not attached to the parent link.

We should consider explicitly adding the requirement that world not be specified as the child link of a joint to the proposal and SDF specification.

* Format fixes

* Backport URDF multiplication and linter

* Reduce redundant value setting

* Remove clip req for depth camera

* Close branch add_depth_clip

* Close branch backport_urdf_stuff

* 8.7.0

* Added tag sdformat8_8.7.0 for changeset a9dd4dc9fe68

values.description:
SDFormat looks for files defined in `<include>` tags on all paths defined by the `SDF_PATH` environment variable.

Right now, that only handles relative paths. For example:

`export SDF_PATH=/tmp`

~~~
    <include>
      <uri>the_robot</uri>
    </include>
~~~

Would result in SDFormat loading `/tmp/the_robot`.

This PR proposes also handling URIs by stripping their scheme, so this would also be resolved to `/tmp/the_robot`:

~~~
    <include>
      <uri>custom://the_robot</uri>
    </include>
~~~

I can't think of how it could cause an issue. The worst thing that can happen is that the user finds an existing file that they didn't mean to find?
values.title: [Proposal] Remove URI scheme when matching SDF_PATH

summary.raw:
SDFormat looks for files defined in `<include>` tags on all paths defined by the `SDF_PATH` environment variable.

Right now, that only handles relative paths. For example:

`export SDF_PATH=/tmp`

~~~
    <include>
      <uri>the_robot</uri>
    </include>
~~~

Would result in SDFormat loading `/tmp/the_robot`.

This PR proposes also handling URIs by stripping their scheme, so this would also be resolved to `/tmp/the_robot`:

~~~
    <include>
      <uri>custom://the_robot</uri>
    </include>
~~~

I can't think of how it could cause an issue. The worst thing that can happen is that the user finds an existing file that they didn't mean to find?
summary.html:
SDFormat looks for files defined in <include> tags on all paths defined by the SDF_PATH environment variable.

Right now, that only handles relative paths. For example:

export SDF_PATH=/tmp

    <include>
      <uri>the_robot</uri>
    </include>

Would result in SDFormat loading /tmp/the_robot.

This PR proposes also handling URIs by stripping their scheme, so this would also be resolved to /tmp/the_robot:

    <include>
      <uri>custom://the_robot</uri>
    </include>

I can't think of how it could cause an issue. The worst thing that can happen is that the user finds an existing file that they didn't mean to find?

values.reason: I'm backporting a version of this to sdf8

values.description: The spec has allowed for joint elements directly under a world, but these have never been used, so let's just remove them. If we want to re-add similar behavior, we should make a proposal in a design document for how it would work.
values.title: sdf 1.7: remove //world/joint element since it has never been used

summary.raw: The spec has allowed for joint elements directly under a world, but these have never been used, so let's just remove them. If we want to re-add similar behavior, we should make a proposal in a design document for how it would work.

values.description: This adds accessors to `ignition::math` shapes. I'm adding this so I don't have to duplicate volume computation in multiple places. This should also have the benefit of exposing Material properties to users when/if we start parsing material properties in SDF.
values.title: Provide ign math shape information

summary.raw: This adds accessors to `ignition::math` shapes. I'm adding this so I don't have to duplicate volume computation in multiple places. This should also have the benefit of exposing Material properties to users when/if we start parsing material properties in SDF.
summary.html: This adds accessors to ignition::math shapes. I'm adding this so I don't have to duplicate volume computation in multiple places. This should also have the benefit of exposing Material properties to users when/if we start parsing material properties in SDF.

values.description: There have been some behavior changes in sdf 1.7, which causes sdformat9 DOM objects to fail to load sdf 1.6 files. This pull request stores the original version of the SDF document that was parsed, so that downstream users can handle errors differently based on the version of the original SDF document. The `OriginalVersion()` accessor and `SetOriginalVersion(string)` functions are added to `sdf::Element` and `sdf::SDF` and set during parsing similar to the way `SetFilePath` is called.
values.title: Access the original parsed version of an SDF document with `Element::OriginalVersion`

summary.raw: There have been some behavior changes in sdf 1.7, which causes sdformat9 DOM objects to fail to load sdf 1.6 files. This pull request stores the original version of the SDF document that was parsed, so that downstream users can handle errors differently based on the version of the original SDF document. The `OriginalVersion()` accessor and `SetOriginalVersion(string)` functions are added to `sdf::Element` and `sdf::SDF` and set during parsing similar to the way `SetFilePath` is called.
summary.html: There have been some behavior changes in sdf 1.7, which causes sdformat9 DOM objects to fail to load sdf 1.6 files. This pull request stores the original version of the SDF document that was parsed, so that downstream users can handle errors differently based on the version of the original SDF document. The OriginalVersion() accessor and SetOriginalVersion(string) functions are added to sdf::Element and sdf::SDF and set during parsing similar to the way SetFilePath is called.

values.description:
When a move assignment was happening, the current contents of dataPtr were being leaked, as they were never free'd/deleted.

This was discovered when diagnosing [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/47/possible-log-playback-memory-leak](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/47/possible-log-playback-memory-leak). In that case, log playback was causing `EntityComponentManager::SetState` very frequently, which makes use of move assignments on different component types. Since some of our components are `sdf::*` objects, this was surfaced.

The leaking can be verified by running at of the `UNIT_*_TEST` tests in sdformat under `valgrind`

```
(blueprint)➜  sdformat8 valgrind --tool=memcheck --leak-check=full ./src/UNIT_Material_TEST 
==19839== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==19839== Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==19839== Using Valgrind-3.13.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==19839== Command: ./src/UNIT_Material_TEST
==19839== 
Running main() from gtest_main.cc
[==========] Running 8 tests from 2 test cases.
[----------] Global test environment set-up.
[----------] 7 tests from DOMMaterial
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.Construction
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.Construction (10 ms)
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.MoveConstructor
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.MoveConstructor (6 ms)
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.CopyConstructor
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.CopyConstructor (5 ms)
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.AssignmentOperator
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.AssignmentOperator (4 ms)
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.MoveAssignmentOperator
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.MoveAssignmentOperator (5 ms)
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.Set
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.Set (16 ms)
[ RUN      ] DOMMaterial.InvalidSdf
[       OK ] DOMMaterial.InvalidSdf (6 ms)
[----------] 7 tests from DOMMaterial (56 ms total)

[----------] 1 test from DOMAtmosphere
[ RUN      ] DOMAtmosphere.CopyAssignmentAfterMove
[       OK ] DOMAtmosphere.CopyAssignmentAfterMove (2 ms)
[----------] 1 test from DOMAtmosphere (3 ms total)

[----------] Global test environment tear-down
[==========] 8 tests from 2 test cases ran. (74 ms total)
[  PASSED  ] 8 tests.
==19839== 
==19839== HEAP SUMMARY:
==19839==     in use at exit: 232 bytes in 1 blocks
==19839==   total heap usage: 3,564 allocs, 3,563 frees, 3,916,665 bytes allocated
==19839== 
==19839== 232 bytes in 1 blocks are definitely lost in loss record 1 of 1
==19839==    at 0x4C3017F: operator new(unsigned long) (in /usr/lib/valgrind/vgpreload_memcheck-amd64-linux.so)
==19839==    by 0x4EC5EDA: sdf::v8::Material::Material() (Material.cc:66)
==19839==    by 0x11D0FA: DOMMaterial_MoveAssignmentOperator_Test::TestBody() (Material_TEST.cc:143)
==19839==    by 0x14D029: HandleSehExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::Test, void> (gtest.cc:2421)
==19839==    by 0x14D029: void testing::internal::HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::Test, void>(testing::Test*, void (testing::Test::*)(), char const*) (gtest.cc:2457)
==19839==    by 0x142E29: Run (gtest.cc:2495)
==19839==    by 0x142E29: testing::Test::Run() (gtest.cc:2486)
==19839==    by 0x142F77: Run (gtest.cc:2671)
==19839==    by 0x142F77: testing::TestInfo::Run() (gtest.cc:2645)
==19839==    by 0x143054: Run (gtest.cc:2789)
==19839==    by 0x143054: testing::TestCase::Run() (gtest.cc:2774)
==19839==    by 0x14357B: testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() (gtest.cc:5051)
==19839==    by 0x14D539: HandleSehExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::internal::UnitTestImpl, bool> (gtest.cc:2421)
==19839==    by 0x14D539: bool testing::internal::HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::internal::UnitTestImpl, bool>(testing::internal::UnitTestImpl*, bool (testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::*)(), char const*) (gtest.cc:2457)
==19839==    by 0x1436AB: testing::UnitTest::Run() (gtest.cc:4667)
==19839==    by 0x1194A8: RUN_ALL_TESTS (gtest.h:2329)
==19839==    by 0x1194A8: main (gtest_main.cc:37)
==19839==

==19839==    definitely lost: 232 bytes in 1 blocks
==19839==    indirectly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==19839==      possibly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==19839==    still reachable: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==19839==         suppressed: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==19839== 
==19839== For counts of detected and suppressed errors, rerun with: -v
==19839== ERROR SUMMARY: 1 errors from 1 contexts (suppressed: 0 from 0)
```

‌

The leaks are gone after these modifications.
values.title: Fix move assignment constructor leaks

When a move assignment was happening, the current contents of dataPtr were being leaked, as they were never free'd/deleted.

This was discovered when diagnosing [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/47/possible-log-playback-memory-leak](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/issues/47/possible-log-playback-memory-leak). values.title: Change default cylinder radius to 0.5 meters

values.description:
This refactor does the following:

* Puts the rule-of-5 functions in a consistent order.  I choose:

    * Constructor
    * Destructor
    * Copy Constructor
    * Move Constructor
    * Copy Assignment
    * Move Assignment
    
* Replaces the move constructor logic with std::exchange
* Changes the copy assignment logic to use the copy constructor.
* Backports @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1} 's converter memory leak fix.

In a follow-up, we can remove the `CopyFrom` functions, as they aren’t needed with the copy assignment refactor, but since they are public, there are API implications.

With this, we get a clean test run with ASAN, with the exception of `UNIT_ign_TEST`, which modifies the LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH and disrupts ASAN.
values.title: Rule of five refactor

summary.raw:
This refactor does the following:

* Puts the rule-of-5 functions in a consistent order.  I choose:

    * Constructor
    * Destructor
    * Copy Constructor
    * Move Constructor
    * Copy Assignment
    * Move Assignment
    
* Replaces the move constructor logic with std::exchange
* Changes the copy assignment logic to use the copy constructor.
* Backports @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1} 's converter memory leak fix.

In a follow-up, we can remove the `CopyFrom` functions, as they aren’t needed with the copy assignment refactor, but since they are public, there are API implications.

With this, we get a clean test run with ASAN, with the exception of `UNIT_ign_TEST`, which modifies the LD\_LIBRARY\_PATH and disrupts ASAN.
summary.html:
This refactor does the following:

  • Puts the rule-of-5 functions in a consistent order. I choose:

    • Constructor
    • Destructor
    • Copy Constructor
    • Move Constructor
    • Copy Assignment
    • Move Assignment

  • Replaces the move constructor logic with std::exchange

  • Changes the copy assignment logic to use the copy constructor.
  • Backports @Eric Cousineau 's converter memory leak fix.

In a follow-up, we can remove the CopyFrom functions, as they aren’t needed with the copy assignment refactor, but since they are public, there are API implications.

With this, we get a clean test run with ASAN, with the exception of UNIT_ign_TEST, which modifies the LD_LIBRARY_PATH and disrupts ASAN.

* Forward Port #644 \(rule-of-five-refactor\)

values.description: The `sdf::readFile` and `sdf::readString` functions all automatically convert an sdf file to the latest version. With the large changes in sdf 1.7, it is nice to be able to load a file without converting it forward. This adds `readFile` and `readString` overloads to parser.hh that have a boolean argument for whether to conver to the latest version or not.
values.title: Parser: add boolean parameter to `readFile` and `readString` for disabling conversion to latest SDF spec.

summary.raw: The `sdf::readFile` and `sdf::readString` functions all automatically convert an sdf file to the latest version. With the large changes in sdf 1.7, it is nice to be able to load a file without converting it forward. This adds `readFile` and `readString` overloads to parser.hh that have a boolean argument for whether to conver to the latest version or not.
summary.html: The sdf::readFile and sdf::readString functions all automatically convert an sdf file to the latest version. With the large changes in sdf 1.7, it is nice to be able to load a file without converting it forward. This adds readFile and readString overloads to parser.hh that have a boolean argument for whether to conver to the latest version or not.

values.description: We added a workaround for name collisions between links, joints, and frames in 10466df2e64f (pull request #621), but now that we can detect the original version of an sdf file, only do the workaround for old files.
values.title: Model::Load: fail fast if an sdf 1.7 file has name collisions

summary.raw: We added a workaround for name collisions between links, joints, and frames in 10466df2e64f (pull request #621), but now that we can detect the original version of an sdf file, only do the workaround for old files.
summary.html: We added a workaround for name collisions between links, joints, and frames in 10466df2e64f (pull request #621), but now that we can detect the original version of an sdf file, only do the workaround for old files.

values.description:
Parsing of `<pose>` elements under `<include>` threw an exception for poses with empty values (eg. `<pose />`), which were added in SDFormat 1.7. Furthermore, when an empty `relative_to` attribute was encountered, it wasn't being used to reset the included model's `relative_to` attribute.

Relevant discussion [here](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3133/support-sdformat-17-frame-semantics/diff#comment-133107374)
values.title: Fix parsing of pose elements under <include>

summary.raw:
Parsing of `<pose>` elements under `<include>` threw an exception for poses with empty values (eg. `<pose />`), which were added in SDFormat 1.7. Furthermore, when an empty `relative_to` attribute was encountered, it wasn't being used to reset the included model's `relative_to` attribute.

Relevant discussion [here](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3133/support-sdformat-17-frame-semantics/diff#comment-133107374)
summary.html:
Parsing of <pose> elements under <include> threw an exception for poses with empty values (eg. <pose />), which were added in SDFormat 1.7. Furthermore, when an empty relative_to attribute was encountered, it wasn't being used to reset the included model's relative_to attribute.

Relevant discussion here

values.description:
This is a backport of pull request #636. The functionality is expanded a bit to support:

1. Terminal 1: `ign gazebo -v 4`
2. Terminal 2: `ign service -s /world/default/create --reqtype ignition.msgs.EntityFactory --reptype ignition.msgs.Boolean --timeout 300 --req 'sdf_filename: "file:///<path_to_model_directory>"'`

‌
values.title: Remove URI scehem when finding files
